Legal_Issue: Breach of natural justice principles, Misconstruction of evidence
Application_Facts: Interpreter omitted answers, altered questions, provided unsolicited responses, and gave directions; tribunal misconstrued key facts in testimony and personal information form
Court_Ruling: Decision overturned and case remitted for reevaluation by a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Tribunal failed to ensure proper interpretation and misinterpreted evidence
Legal_Standard: Interpretation must be continuous, precise, impartial, competent, and contemporaneous
Assessment_Factor: Quality of interpretation, Accuracy of factual findings
Procedural_Issue: Breach of natural justice due to inadequate interpretation
Review_Standard: Judicial review for perversity or capriciousness
Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly addressed, but affected by misinterpreted evidence
Application_Basis: Refugee claim based on fear of persecution
Governing_Rule: Interpretation standards and correct application of evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Omissions, alterations, and unauthorized input by interpreter
Harm_Assessment: Risk of unfair determination due to flawed process
Cause_Description: Applicants challenged rejection of refugee claims due to interpretation errors and factual misinterpretations
Evidence_Handling: Improper handling due to interpreter misconduct and tribunal error
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete, altered, and improperly influenced interpretation
Misrepresentation_Element: Interpreter provided unsolicited responses and altered questions
Evidence_Assessment: Findings deemed perverse or capricious due to misinterpretation
Decision_Rationale: Breach of natural justice and failure to meet interpretation standards
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of accurate, complete, and impartial interpretation
Legal_Standard_Applied: Standards for interpretation and avoidance of capricious findings
